boardgame.name: Adjective Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adjective Fuel is a 1,000 adjective word table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls. The adjectives are mostly American English based.

It is multipurpose in that random adjectives may be used for different reasons. Two purposes mentioned are using keywords to describe a scene or to use the keyword in dialogue to describe nouns. These words are a large resource pool that can fuel sandbox style roleplaying games.

boardgame.name: Adverb Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adverb Fuel is a 1,000 adverb word table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls, from Above to Zestily. The adverbs are mostly American English based.

Adverbs concern time (ex already, lately), place (ex nearby, there), manner (ex carefully, cunningly, stealthily), degree (ex absolutely, almost), and certainty (maybe, possibly),

It is multipurpose in that random adverbs may be used for different reasons. Two purposes mentioned are using keywords to add greater detail to action or description of a scene or to use the keyword in dialogue. These words are a large resource pool that can fuel sandbox style roleplaying games.

boardgame.name: Article, Determiner, & Conjunction Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Article, Determiner, & Conjunction Fuel is a 225 words on five tables alphabetized and numbered for d10, d20, or d100 rolls (5 articles, 100 determiners from A to Your, 8 coordinating conjunctions from And to Nor, 20 correlative conjunctions from As...as to Whether...or, and 100 subordinating conjunctions from Afore to Why). The words are mostly American English based.

Article Words – Articles are definite (the) or indefinite.

Determiner Words – Determiners reference nouns and noun phrases in the context. Determiners express existence, define particularity, distinguish which noun entities, attribute possession, indicate quantity, consider individual members, and indicate unknown noun entities.

boardgame.name: Zero Gravity
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Zero Gravity is a pong game with a 3D view and a space theme.

boardgame.name: Mysteriez: Hidden Numbers
boardgame.description:
Numbers surround us everywhere. What secrets do they conceal? Find it out in Mysteriez: Hidden Numbers, a fun and addicting hidden object game! Put your hide-and-seek talents to test, inspect dozens of colorful canvases and try to find all 40 disguised numbers before the time is up. Each theme level pack includes ten tricky hidden object scenes. You will have only 5 minutes to scour a picture and prove your detective skills.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Environmental Mechanisms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This environmental mechanism book has tools to help create brief descriptive mostly outdoor setting, weather, terrain, natural disasters, Earth-like animals, and even fantasy worlds. The focus of the tools are to create description in brief-but-unique sentence descriptions made with keywords. Each of the tools focuses on using specific biome, terrain, type of environmental event, sensory experience, or life type keywords or details.

boardgame.name: Grammar Fuel: 12,000 Phrases & Idioms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Grammar Fuel: 12,000 Phrases & Idioms is a 12,000 phrases and idioms on 12 tables alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls. The idioms are mostly American English based.

boardgame.name: Grammar Fuel: Parts of Speech
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This includes all of the Noun, Verb, Adjective, Pronoun, Adverb, Preposition, Article, Determiner, Conjunction, and Interjection Fuel tables equaling 15 tables.

boardgame.name: Idioms A to F Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Idioms A - F Fuel is a 1000 idioms on a table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls (from 15 minutes of fame to Fool around). The prepositional idioms are mostly American English based.

boardgame.name: Idioms F to L Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These idioms are different than the first Idioms A - F Fuel book table and help bring the total up to 2000 total idioms combining the two tables from the two books.

boardgame.name: Idioms L to P Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These idioms are different than the first two Idioms Fuel book tables and help bring the total up to 3000 total idioms combining the two tables from the two books (not counting the idioms in Prepositional Phrase Fuel).

boardgame.name: Idioms P to S Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These idioms are different than the first three Idioms Fuel book tables and help bring the total up to 4000 total idioms combining the four tables from the four books (not counting the idioms in Prepositional Phrase Fuel).

boardgame.name: Idioms SE' to SP' Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Idioms Se' to Se' Fuel is a 1000 idioms on a table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls (from Settle into something to Split something down the middle). The idioms are mostly American English based.

boardgame.name: Idioms SP' to SW' Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Idioms Sp' to Sw' Fuel is a 1000 idioms on a table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls (from Split people up to Swallow up). The idioms are mostly American English based.

boardgame.name: Idioms SW' to TH' Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Idioms Sw' to Th' Fuel is a 1000 idioms on a table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls (from Swamp someone or something with something to That’s that). The idioms are mostly American English based.

boardgame.name: Idioms THA' to THER' Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Idioms Tha' to Ther' Fuel is a 1000 idioms on a table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls (from That’s not my problem to There are other good fish in the sea). The idioms are mostly American English based.

boardgame.name: Idioms THER' to TOP Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Idioms Ther' to Top Fuel is a 1000 idioms on a table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls (from There and back to Top off). The idioms are mostly American English based.

boardgame.name: Idioms TOP to W Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Idioms Top to W Fuel is a 1000 idioms on a table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls (from Top oneself and Whatever you say). The idioms are mostly American English based.

boardgame.name: Idioms W to Z Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Idioms W to Z Fuel is a 1000 idioms on a table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls (from Whatever it takes to Zoom up). The idioms are mostly American English based.

boardgame.name: Interjection Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Interjection Fuel is a 1000 interjections on a table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls (from A-choo to Zing). The interjections are mostly modern American English based. This table tries to avoid most profanity, with something like suck it, OMG, or drop dead being the worst.

Interjection Words – an utterance that which expresses a spontaneous feeling or reaction. It includes greetings, calls, sounds (onomatopoeia), exclamations, curses, pauses, and commands. Interjections are punctuated with an exclamation point or attached to a related sentence with a comma.

It is multipurpose in that random interjections may be used for different reasons. Interjections give greater emotional outbursts and sounds to a scene.

boardgame.name: More Adjective Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

More Adjective Fuel is a 1,000 additional adjective word table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls. These adjectives are different than the first Adjective Fuel table and help bring the total up to 2000 total adjectives combining the two tables. The adjectives are mostly American English based.

boardgame.name: More Noun Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

More Noun Fuel is 1,000 additional noun word table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls. When combined with the first Noun Fuel, 2,000 nouns of general use people, places, things, and ideas are included. The nouns are mostly American English based. From Ability to Youth, most are non-genre specific nouns.

boardgame.name: More Verb Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

More Verb Fuel is a 1,000 additional verb word table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls. These verbs are different than the first Verb Fuel table and help bring the total up to 2000 total verbs combining the two tables. The verbs are mostly American English based.

boardgame.name: Noun Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Noun Fuel is a 1,000 noun word table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls. The nouns are mostly American English based. From Abdomen to Zone, most are non-genre specific nouns.

It is multipurpose in that random noun may be used for different reasons. Two purposes mentioned are using keywords to state the name of a person, place, thing, idea, state, or quality in a scene or to use the keyword in dialogue to name topics, subjects, objects, locations, and ideas. These words are a large resource pool that can fuel sandbox style roleplaying games.

boardgame.name: Prepositional Phrase Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Prepositional Phrase Fuel is a 1000 phrases on a table alphabetized and numbered for d1000 rolls (from Above all to Within walking distance). The prepositional phrases are mostly American English based

Prepositional Phrase Words – How can you quickly modify a noun, verb, or adjective? Prepositional phrases provide further information about more exactly what, when, where, and why for nouns, verbs, and adjectives. These words may be used to expand upon the relationship of the time, space, location, direction, agent, and instrument of the action and description of a scene. Prepositional phrases begin with as preposition and end with an object of the preposition—and may or may not include modifiers. When to roll: When a character needs to know even greater detail about something described or happening, that the character doesn’t already know, from observing or asking someone else. Some of the phrases are idioms.

Idiom – an expression that has figurative meaning, not always apparent by the words used.

It is multipurpose in that random preposition phrases may be used for different reasons. Two purposes mentioned. A first use is it's helpful for when a character needs to know even greater information about the when, where, why, or how of a sentence or statement. A second use is in helping to flesh out dialogue either to indicate greater detail about someone, something, or somewhere. These words are a large resource pools that can fuel sandbox style roleplaying games.

boardgame.name: Pronoun & Preposition Fuel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pronoun & Preposition Fuel is a 350 words on two tables alphabetized and numbered for d100 or d1000 rolls (100 pronouns from All to Yourselves) or (250 prepositions from Aboard to Worth). The pronouns and prepositions are mostly American English based.

Pronouns take the place of nouns and nouns phrases. Some personal pronouns function to tell person, number, and even gender. Personal pronouns can also function to reflect grammatical function (subject, object, determiner possessive, independent possessive, and reflexive). Other pronouns function to represent spatial distance, proximity locations, or abstract difference. Demonstrative pronouns point towards things. Interrogative pronouns, used in questions, represent unknown things. Reflexive pronouns refer back to the subject. Reciprocal pronouns are used for two or more subjects act towards the other. Relative pronouns introduce relative clauses. Indefinite pronouns are vague and don’t refer to a specific person, thing, or amount.

boardgame.name: Remnant RPG Tools All-in-One
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This remnant RPG tools book has tools to help have more descriptive violent combat. One strike kills and limb severence are possible with this tool. Because of this, this book is for more mature gamers.

This also brings together a revised and slightly expanded combat system from the minimalist system, three descriptive combat critical tables, minimalist skills, minimalist elemental effects, minimalist: fear, disgust, & madness, and minimalist: ghosts, angels, & demons.

boardgame.name: Minimalist Force of Nature: Ground
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The adventurers traveling over the hilly terrain approach a cursed, monthly-active, steep conical cinder cone volcano.

This is a minimalist force of nature, ground activity generator to help randomly roll a brief ground force description for a setting description for gaming or writing. It helps generate ground force types (tsunami, volcanic, hydrothermal, landslide, earthquake, groundwater ...), terrain, features, volcanic eruption frequency, earthquake intensity, tsunami wave height, geysers, spring water, mineral water, and quicksand.

One-page, easy, standard d6 dice system that may be used with any core system.

boardgame.name: Minimalist Descriptive Desert
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The adventurers traveling over the hilly desert through a foggy mist, approach an dangerous, Joshua tree-covered area.

This is a minimalist descriptive desert generator to help randomly roll a dry setting for gaming or writing. It helps generate arid desert types (wadis, oasis, canyons), terrain, weather, features, life: grass & shrubs, trees, succulents, insects, birds, mammals, and reptiles: camel, lizards, snakes, scorpions, meercats, etc... .

One-page, easy, standard d6 dice system that may be used with any core system.

boardgame.name: Corrugated Jungle
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Jungle. Be the first to build 9 cardboard animals to win the game. Make sure to build in the right "peeking Order" [PO] while trying to avoid evil cog animals.

These cute critters are interesting to build using action points (cut & Paste) and cardboard values. Take your time to figure out the best animals to use as resources.

A strong use for 7 simple postcards + rules.

In Solo mode you will need to recycle nine animals twice to win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 100 Cybernetic Weapons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cyber weapons come in a wide variety of shapes and forms - from monoblades, whips, garrotes, and hand guns to micro missiles, grenades, acid sprays, electric shocks and even radioactive materials. This list gives you a broad range of weapons to define your next punk, villain, hero, or rebel. Let the mayhem, madness, and murder begin.

This list is intended for any dark future setting (like Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Rifts, or any modern superhero settings) where technology is running rampant, and cybernetics are common. Whether this list is applied to a cyberpsycho, some up and coming arms dealer, or a corporate suit desperate for power, this roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to dress up your next trigger-happy maniac with a need to put their opponents in their place.

boardgame.name: 100 Street Weapons for Cyber City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Weapons are as old as the human race, taking all sizes, shapes and forms. Cyber City has become a haven for weapons as the necessary tools in an endless struggle for survival.

This list is intended for any dark future setting where technology is running rampant, and weapons are common. Whether this list is applied to a cyberpsycho, a street samurai, a gang member or just a scared kid, you can use this tool to give you anything from a single weapon to an easy arsenal. Note: The weapons in this list are generally not too expensive, rare or exotic. We have also left heavy weapons, vehicular weapons and traps off this list since they often require unusual training, access or cyber.

boardgame.name: 100 Cyber Finger Devices
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

If your character has a cybernetic arm or hand then there’s a good chance you have a hand with different devices built into the fingers. For a bit more money, you can have quick change mounts to allow you to replace fingers with other fingers in order to have different functions at your disposal. It’s flexible, it’s affordable, and you can tailor it to your specific desires without hours in the chair and a costly recovery. And for a referee, all the optional fingers mean you can take a character from the fistfight to date night without skipping a beat.

This list is intended for any dark future setting where technology is everywhere, and the criminal / street element is common. This list includes weapons, sensors, tools (mechanical, medical, and scientific), and even hobbyware that can be applied to any cybernetic hand. Any fingers that are available only on the black market are marked with an asterix (*). All costs and specific rule mechanics for different devices are left to the individual referee.

boardgame.name: 100 Items in a Corporate's Pocket
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Corporates are the business supervisors, corporate raiders and managers who act on the organization’s behalf as they work with freelancers, governments, other businesses, markets, and the street. Corporates are protected by the influence they exercise and how important they are to the company as a whole. Often the greatest danger they face are from other Corporates looking to plunder their power and take it on as their own.

This list is intended for any dark future setting where technology is running rampant, and corporations are powerful and common. This list can be applied to a beaten manager, a captured corporate, the contents of a desk in a home office, or an unemployed supervisor looking for a new corporate master before the street swallows him whole. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next power broker.

boardgame.name: 100 Classic Cars of the 1930's
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What did people in the 1930’s drive? Was it just all those old Model T’s and Model A’s from New York to the dust bowl? What about the rich? The young adventurer? What about people in other lands? What about people who wanted a roadster? A touring car? What if your player decides to steal a car and just want to know what’s available?

This list includes details on the year that the car was introduced, the type of car, the type of roof (convertible (CV), fixed roof (RF) or no roof (NR)), the number of people it can comfortably seat (a number like “+2” means they are utilizing rumble seats) and the color of the car. Since each car is historically accurate, you can search and find details on each car to fit your game system. Hate your result? Just substitute it out for a Ford Model A and no one will ever know.

boardgame.name: 100 Speakeasy Drinks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The speakeasy of the 1920’s and 1930’s was full of moonshine, bathtub gin, and other homemade hooch. And those very rough alcohols pushed people to develop cocktails to blend and obscure those tastes for more delicate and refined drinkers. These 100 cocktails were really available during prohibition in North America and abroad.

The entries in this list include the name of the cocktail and the ingredients blended together to create it. All the cocktails are assumed to be in a cocktail glass unless they have an * after the cocktail’s name (these exceptions are typically found in a Collins, Wine or Old Fashioned Glass). To save space, we use these abbreviations: CS= Club Soda / H2O = Water / Fruit = Fruit Juice / OJ = Orange Juice / Bit = Bitters/ Syrup = Simple Syrup. This fun little tool lets you add a new dimension to your speakeasy adventure, or to your next real life drinking game.

boardgame.name: 100 Speakeasy Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Speakeasy is a term for an illegal bar or restaurant that sold alcohol between 1920 and 1933 (the time of prohibition). The speakeasy helped to change the United States by ushering in the notion of dating, mixing the races and sexes over drinks, and a new sense of lawlessness into the country. Many cities had thousands of speakeasies during prohibition.

Each speakeasy encounter provides enough information to provide a bit of color to the speakeasy - whether that’s in the form of information, romance, humor, violence or intrigue. This roleplaying tool can be reused over and over to give you dozens of different ways to dress up your speakeasy location without a heavy investment of time or energy. This product works smoothly with another D10 Dimensions product - 100 Speakeasies.

boardgame.name: 100 Speakeasies of the Roaring 20's
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Speakeasy is a term for an illegal bar or restaurant that sold alcohol between 1920 and 1933 (the time of prohibition). The speakeasy helped to change the United States by ushering in the notion of dating, mixing the races and sexes over drinks, and a new sense of lawlessness into the country. Many cities had thousands of speakeasies during prohibition.

Each speakeasy entry includes the name of the speakeasy, the cost rating ($ - Cheap; $$ - Average; $$$ - Expensive), a theme or factor related to it’s appearance, and some distinctive feature or features related to this speakeasy. Any speakeasy with an asterix (*) after it’s name has some connection to organized crime. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to dress up your speakeasy location without a heavy investment of time or energy. This product works smoothly with other D10 Dimensions products such as “100 Speakeasy Encounters”.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Forest Finds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list is intended for any fantasy setting where mysteries and secrets are plentiful and ever-present in a hostile world. This list can be applied to a small grove of trees, a common forest, a overrun wilderness, or a timberland of forts and new industry. We recommend that Game Masters apply 1 to 3 rolls on this table (if they are in a larger area, then this number can easily double). This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension of personality to the area being explored.

boardgame.name: 100 Killer Kobold Tactics
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list is intended for any fantasy setting where monstrous humanoids need to develop tricks, traps, strategies, and tactics in order to survive in a hostile world. This list can be applied to a temporary lair, an underground complex, a ruin, or a group of humanoids working together with some level of cooperation. We recommend that the humanoids adopt 1 to 3 rolls on this table (if they are more established in the area, this number can easily double). This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension of difficulty to the lair that they must defend.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Bard Instruments
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This product is intended for any fantasy setting where bards and musicians are reasonably plentiful and willing to walk proudly in a hostile world. This list can be applied to a King’s herald, a local entertainer in a small town, a professional travelling bard moving between city states, and amateur minstrels of all types and shapes. We recommend that the Game Masters allow musicians to apply their skills among the different instrument families (essentially a skill in the metal horn family applies to all instruments in that family (like a slide trumpet or a fanfare trumpet)). This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension of personality and nuance to these musical characters.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Dock Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Port Cities and towns have a certain mystic in the world of Fantasy where tall ships weigh anchor and sailors come about to test their land legs once again. And with that notion of going from one element to another, we often see the laws of order and nature strained. Whether this is a crooked captain looking to unload some con-traband at a black market, or a monster searching for an easy snack, the docks, the edge of land and the constant waves makes for a strange and chaotic environment. And it seems like a shame not to take the utmost advantage of that situation in a fantasy game where the coast line represents mystery and opportunity for all with the strength to explore it.

This list is intended for any fantasy setting where monster and crime are plentiful and bold in a hostile world. This list can be applied to a small town, a city state, a coastal ruin, or a fortified docking station. We recommend that the Game Masters apply 1 to 3 rolls on this table (if they are in a larger area, then this number can easily double). This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension of personality and difficulty to the area being explored.

boardgame.name: 100 Alchemical Creations • Fantasy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Alchemy. It can level out the field of battle by offering unusual attacks, save lives with new chances for healing, and a host of abilities that require no spellcaster or ritual. However, for most players, this resource is found either in the pockets of the fallen or in a cluttered shop far from battle. And since alchemical creations must be made in advance, shopping for it requires that familiar dreaded question – “So, what do they have for sale?”

This list provides you with ideas and alternatives to finding and a flask of alchemist fire here or a bottle of acid there. Just roll the dice and you’ll find an array of different creations that can be useful regardless of the situation. And for the players, this tool could be a way to ask for something that they never thought of, or didn’t know existed.

boardgame.name: 100 Alternatives to a Total Party Kill • Fantasy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The term Total Party Kill (TPK) refers to a time in a campaign when the entire group is threatened with certain death. While some regard this as the simple result of bad decisions or bad dice rolls, the fact remains that this can cause the abrupt end to a grand adventure or a strong story. This list provides you with ideas and alternatives to simply ending everything by building on the legend of these heroes by giving them new obstacles to overcome and a new chapter in their careers.

This list is intended for any fantasy setting where swords and sorcery run rampant, and the power of an evil leader is real. Whether applied to the results of a failed battle, total betrayal by a hireling, or the simples results of bad luck and bad planning, this roleplaying tool gives the Game Master dozens of different ways to add a little more life to what could be a premature end to the campaign. And for the players, this tool could be a way light the imagination of your game master for a less final result.

boardgame.name: A7V: The German Tank Offensive at Villers-Bretonneux, 1918
boardgame.description:
A7V depicts the first large scale use of German A7V tanks during the battle for Villers-Bretonneux, April 24-25, 1918.

The battle for this key town happened several times before because it was a key railroad junction that led to Amiens, a British\French occupied city.
Knowing this, the Germans planned their tank attack comprising of 13 A7V and assault troops after their major offensive, Michael, had failed by late March, 1918.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Eternal Cylinder
boardgame.description: An ambitious take on open-world survival adventure games.

boardgame.name: Eldest Souls
boardgame.description: The Old Gods have long been imprisoned. Humanity has prospered. Great Kingdoms have arisen from the now forsaken temples of worship.

boardgame.name: Skate Story
boardgame.description: kate Story puts you in control of a crystalline figure, like a low-poly Silver Surfer

boardgame.name: Gori: Cuddly Carnage
boardgame.description: Are you ready for a third-person, hoverboarding hack & Slash with lots of blood, toys, glitter and adorable cuteness?

boardgame.name: Jay and Silent Bob: Chronic Blunt Punch
boardgame.description: Movie, Book, TV show

boardgame.name: Vigil: The Longest Night
boardgame.description: Vigil: The Longest Night aims to challenge players with its difficulty while compelling them with a tale of eldritch horror.

boardgame.name: 30XX
boardgame.description: Jump, shoot, and slash your way through 30XX, the roguelike action platformer you can play with a friend!

boardgame.name: Source of Madness
boardgame.description: Source of Madness is a dark action roguelite, where you use a wide variety of magic against an infinite host of ever-changing monsters. You play as newly initiated acolytes at the tower of knowledge. Humanity barely hangs on by a slim thread.

boardgame.name: Skeleton Crew
boardgame.description: Kick everything: friends, foes, items... chickens? Skeleton Crew is a gothic platformer with a pinball-like twist. Defeat a skeleton archer and kick his skull into a crowd of enemies. Launch your friends around the map to reach secret areas and solve fiendish puzzles in up to 4-player co-op.

boardgame.name: Speed Limit
boardgame.description: A daily train commute gone wrong: Speed Limit is a one take, non-stop arcade experience that never slows down. An old-school shooter boiled down to its core elements: Hard. Fast. Addictive.

boardgame.name: Wolfstride
boardgame.description: Winning the Ultimate Mech Tournament takes tactical skills to defeat opponents in epic GIANT MECH BATTLES and strategic savvy to repair and upgrade your Mech with the shiniest engines the world has seen. But you gotta pay up! Hit the streets to take any jobs the mysterious locals have to offer.

boardgame.name: Grumple's Forge and Feast
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The cobblestone leads you through the tight tunneled paths and to the large oaken doors of the Forge and Feast. A small stable sits to one side while another smaller building functioning as a storehouse sits to the other.

Inside stone catwalks lead over the main feasting area and down sets of stairs. Fires are roasting delicious smelling boar and the tables are all full of fantastical delights.

Adventure Seed

The patrons of this bar are making a toast as you walk in. Suddenly a very confused looking ogre appears, whilst a patron next to it disintegrates into a pile of coins. Pigs roasting on spits begin speaking and bolts of lightning strike out towards the stone ceiling.

Small, strange creatures appear, wailing in fear and scurrying under seats, before vanishing again. A table sprouts human legs, shaking off platters of food and drink before walking up the stairs, out of the bar.

A woman grows a beard so large and magnificent it puts her husband’s to shame, whilst a dwarf is transformed into a grinning succubus (who subsequently embraces his companion in a passionate kiss). Some patrons go blue or pink and a group of children start levitating. Elsewhere, puffs of flame emerge from a small, pink dragon testing its breath.

The ogre, now having a tantrum, begins to smash furniture and patrons with its fists. The guests begin screaming and press their way out of the bar in panic whilst a still-sober bartender freaks out.

Noticing your party, the bartender begs you to do something to stop the ogre before his establishment is completely destroyed and his livelihood is lost. He’ll give you anything he has left that’s of value!

What’s happening? The owner of the bar bought the wrong, discounted crate of drinks. Thinking he was buying some strange intoxicants “under the counter” he was instead sold bottles of chaotic magical energy that were stolen en-route to the town’s local wizard.

The wizard has been looking for his missing delivery for the last two days.

Now all of its patrons have been affected by magical flux, but the effects should wear off within an hour. Mostly.

boardgame.name: The Feasting Hall
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The cobblestone path leads you through the snowy forest and to large oaken doors. A small stable sits to one side while another smaller building functioning as a storehouse sits to the other.

Inside stone catwalks lead over the main feasting area and down sets of stairs. Fires are roasting delicious smelling boar and the tables are all full of fantastical delights.

boardgame.name: Bizzack's Bar and Grill
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The cobblestone path leads you through the city and to the large oaken doors of Bizzack’s Bar and Grill. A small stable sits to one side while another smaller building functioning as a storehouse sits to the other.

Inside stone catwalks lead over the main feasting area and down sets of stairs. Fires are roasting delicious smelling boar and the tables are all full of fantastical delights.

Adventure Seed

The patrons of this bar are making a toast as you walk in. Suddenly a very confused looking ogre appears, whilst a patron next to it disintegrates into a pile of coins. Pigs roasting on spits begin speaking and bolts of lightning strike out towards the stone ceiling.

Now all of its patrons have been affected by magical flux, but the effects should wear off within an hour. Mostly.

boardgame.name: Calico
boardgame.description: Calico is a day-in-the-life community sim game where you are given an important and adorable task: rebuild the town’s cat café and fill it with cute and cuddly creatures! Build up your café by filling it with cute furniture, fun decorations, yummy pastries, and get it bustling with animals again!

boardgame.name: Crashed Starmetal Meteor (Night)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Amidst the cold darkness of a desert lies a fallen meteor of starmetal, flames flickering around it. In its wake lies a pool of glowing, molten stone, alongside unearthed rocks once long-hidden.

Adventure Seed

Your party is enjoying the sumptuous celebrations in a desert village renowned for its annual prosperity festival. Every year as a comet blazes across the sky its people celebrate with candied fruits, roasted meat, and copious quantities of fermented cactus sugar before releasing red sky lanterns.

Except this year, as the lanterns are being released, the comet begins to slip from the sky. As the inhabitants of the village begin to scream and panic, the night lights up in a white flash with a loud bang that reverberates in your ears. The comet fragments as it falls, the smaller blazing rocks shaking the land as they collide.

Eventually the main body of the comet crashes beyond a nearby ridge, pushing yurts to the ground and as it sails low overhead. Many people are thrown off their feet by the impact and watch as a large, fiery being rises above the desert ridge, roaring horrifically in a guttural tongue, before shrinking back behind the stones.

What’s happening? Long ago a fire elemental named Arcarix raged through the land, turning it into a burning waste. Only a wizard named Astraphalageous, after losing his wife and children to the calamity, stopped Arcarix before it was too late. He sacrificed his life to imprison the elemental within a fallen comet of skymetal, before sending it up far away; where it should never have touched the land again.

Astraphalageus’s Sacrifice is what the comet became called and is the real reason it was seen as a symbol of prosperity, for it returned hope to the land. However, as time flowed ever onward his sacrifice was forgotten, alongside the true story behind the comet.

Now, hundreds of years later the magic that once bound it has finally unraveled; causing the comet to fall and collide with the land. Arcarix, partially released from his prison, rose above the desert announcing his joy at finally being free in the fire elemental tongue.

Despite his initial hope, Arcarix hasn’t fully escaped his prison. It only cracked during its collision, allowing him to emerge from the comet, but not escape it. The little fires that broke off from him during the collision have become small fire elementals, beginning to foray out into the surrounding sands.

When you arrive the distressed Arcarix is cursing at being partially-imprisoned, whilst tearing chunks of rock away. If you understand and speak to him, he might explain how his active volcano was destroyed by a wizard and how, when he tried to find a new home, that man came after him, locking him away in the darkness where he could barely sustain his flame. Now he just wants to go back to his volcano, unaware of the damage he caused.

With a successful perception check, you can see glowing red runes of sealing inscribed on the meteorite, though they are partially damaged.

If approached by armed adventurers (or anyone who looks like a wizard), Arcarix will lash out and fight to the death.

boardgame.name: Heretics
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

We at the Inquisition like to think we know as much as humanly possible about the supernatural world that surrounds us every day. Unfortunately, that’s not only a daunting task, it’s almost impossible. We discover new chaotic beings often, new otherworldly beings summoned to Earth, and the remnants of non-human societies. It is with great displeasure that I concede to the overwhelming magnitude of the supernatural world and must admit that even the Inquisition remains partially naïve.

The Cryptozoology is a culmination of facts, theories, and speculations as researched and documented by the Inquisition. Each publication contains a collection of adversaries for use across all Shadowed Earth settings, and any fantasy horror or urban fantasy setting. Cryptozoology #03: Heretics presents a collection of humans capable of weaving the various forbidden arts.

boardgame.name: Lost At Sea
boardgame.description: What are the most important moments in your life? Lost At Sea is a game about life. It's about the journey we all take and the monster we all face. Set on a beautiful island, you will fight death and fear to remember the moments that connect us all and make life worth living for everyone of us.

boardgame.name: Malleus Monstrorum Bestiario dei Miti di Cthulhu
Malleus Monstrorum: Bestiariusz Mitów Cthulhu
Malleus Monstrorum: Cthulhu Mythos Bestiary
Malleus Monstrorum: Cthulhu Mythos Bestiary (Volume 1: Monsters of the Mythos)
Malleus Monstrorum: Cthulhu Mythos Bestiary (Volume 2: Deities of the Mythos)
boardgame.description:
From the slip sheet:

That is not dead which can eternal lie,
And with strange aeons even death may die…

Here, shall you know the terrors of the void, the nightmare bringers, and the unspeakable lurkers.

Ancient secrets, whispered lore, and collected facts concerning the alien and otherworldly horrors of the Cthulhu Mythos. A cavalcade of monsters and god-like alien intelligences beyond human understanding, all vividly detailed and portrayed. With over 250 entries to inspire countless adventures.

The information within is designed to bring the creatures and bizarre races of the Cthulhu Mythos to life at the gaming table, as well as all manner of Great Old Ones, Outer Gods, Elder Gods, Avatars, and Unique Beings. Their lore and statistics updated and revised for the Call of Cthulhu 7th edition game. All brought to startling life by the illustrations of expert artist Loïc Muzy.

This two-volume collection is packed with ideas, concepts, and insights to immerse your scenarios and campaigns deep in the heart of the Cthulhu Mythos.

Malleus Monstrorum Band 2 - Gottheiten des Cthulhu-Mythos

boardgame.name: The Cabbage Effect
boardgame.description: Experimental narrative that explores aesthetic elements of non-verbal storytelling and information noises.

boardgame.name: Steampunk Rats
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This pack contains 27 hand-drawn and colored tokens of rats wielding a variety of weapons. Perfect for a steampunk, fantasy or Sci-fi setting.

boardgame.description:

This pack contains 32 hand-drawn and colored tokens of human characters, NPC’s or PC’s.Suitable for most fantasy settings.

This pack contains 32 hand-drawn and colored tokens of characters, NPC’s or PC’s of various races. Suitable for most fantasy settings.

boardgame.description:

This pack contains 31 hand-drawn and colored tokens of a variety of demons and fiends and the people that seek their company. Suitable for most fantasy settings.

boardgame.name: UnDungeon
boardgame.description: Travel between dimensions and change the world around you in an attempt to reconstruct the shattered Multiverse.

boardgame.name: Dungeonbright
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dungeonbright is a fantasy rpg toolkit built to accommodate modern osr or “adventure game” play. It's structured to facilitate fast GM adjudication and diegetic mechanics.

Short game even shorter:


Three abilities (Body, Mind, Spirit)
Three "fields" (Combat, Expertise, Magic)
Skill system allows you to skip related tasks
Mechanics to minimize the amount of rolling
Everything is treated as either a check or a save (including combat)
Dungeons are corrupted by mythological, wholly capital-E evil darkness
Any PC can cast spells, which significantly differ from TSR-era magic (including in-fiction rules for "recharging" failed spells, and all spells being directly related to dungeoneering)

boardgame.name: Minute of Islands
boardgame.description: Explore strange and wonderful islands and dark labyrinths
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee

boardgame.name: Cyanide & Happiness - Freakpocalypse
boardgame.description: Cartoon

boardgame.name: Popup Dungeon
boardgame.description: A papercraft roguelike RPG

boardgame.name: The Ssethregoran Empire
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The reptilian peoples known as ssethrics once dominated all that lived throughout the continent and beyond. From atop the Coiled Throne of Yahssremore, in what is now the First City in the Blessed Lands, they enslaved or exterminated numerous lesser races during the Extinction Wars and became masters of all they surveyed. This dominance was squandered by arrogance and centuries of decadence, after which the ssethrics found themselves overthrown by their own creations and sent fleeing for their lives, far into the swamps and jungles of the south. Now, in the fetid marshes of the Kraldjur Morass live their descendants in the Ssethregoran Empire. Fighting constant wars against the Malfelan elorii and the Altherian Republic, the ssethric races seek to return to their rightful place as the rulers of Known Lands.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires

boardgame.name: Ambition: A Minuet in Power
boardgame.description:
Your choices change the course of history!

It’s March 19th, 1789 and King Louis XVI rules over France from the gilded halls of Versailles. France is a country of elegance and poverty, of ancient tradition and unstoppable change. It is a country on the brink of revolution.

Attend parties, mingle with the rich and powerful, learn their secrets, and use this to get the wealth and power you deserve. Find true love in an opulent world of ever-shifting alliances, that grows more dangerous by the day.

Still, you must always keep your eye on the coming revolution. After all, it’s better to be on the right side of history, than the wrong side of the guillotine.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The reptilian peoples known as ssethrics once dominated all that lived throughout the continent and beyond. From atop the Coiled Throne of Yahssremore, in what is now the First City in the Blessed Lands, they enslaved or exterminated numerous lesser races during the Extinction Wars and became masters of all they surveyed. boardgame.name: Ring of Pain
boardgame.description: Levels are generated randomly from decks of cards, and arranged in a ring, which lets you observe the level and strategise. As you interact with cards the dungeon dynamically adjusts based on what you're doing.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 AGD Awards Best Gameplay of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Four-Colour Apocrypha
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Four-Colour Apocrypha is a superhero world-building game that's not built on unshakeable truths, but incomplete facts, dubious rumours, and unproven opinions, followed up by telling the stories the people in your fictional world are telling through superhero comics! That could be classic cape-and-cowl comics, grim and gritty reboots, or bizarre psychedelic deconstructions of the whole genre—it's all up to you.

boardgame.name: Spellbreak
boardgame.description: Spellbreak is an epic fantasy action spellcasting game where players fight to become an all-powerful battlemage. Weave spectacular spell combinations, craft strategic builds, and master your environment as you dominate the Hollow Lands solo or with friends in a non-stop quest for survival.

Publisher's blurb:

The May 29, 2020 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

The Friday Enhanced map is for personal use only. If you are interested in licensing the map for commercial use, please contact Tim Hartin at Paratime Design for additional info.

Publisher's blurb:

The June 5, 2020 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

The Friday Enhanced map is for personal use only. If you are interested in licensing the map for commercial use, please contact Tim Hartin at Paratime Design for additional info.

The Friday Enhanced map is for personal use only. If you are interested in licensing the map for commercial use, please contact Tim Hartin at Paratime Design for additional info.

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find in a House of Horrors
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The door slams on its own behind you as the thunder, rain, and lightning beat down on the rusty tin roof of this creepy old farmhouse. “Well, I guess we’re stuck here for the night..” you say as you turn to look over at your hitchhiking travel companion… who has suddenly mysteriously disappeared from your presence without so much of a noise or gesture of movement.

This list provides 100 things that you might find in a house of horrors.

boardgame.name: Welcome To Elk
boardgame.description: Welcome to Elk is funny, sweet, surprising and devastating.

boardgame.name: Princess Farmer
boardgame.description: Princess Farmer, blessed by Mother Gaia, can hoist up whole rows of veggies with ease to make matches and smash obstacles by herself, in co-op, or even against a friend! A charming story meets Match-3 Gameplay. Smash rocks! Make combos! Win hearts!

boardgame.name: Drake Hollow
boardgame.description: Team up with friends to build and defend villages of vegetable folk from deadly feral beasts in the blighted world of The Hollow.
boardgame.videogameversion: Live Xbox One/ Series S Downloadable edition

boardgame.name: Suzerain
boardgame.description: As President Rayne, lead Sordland into ruin or repair during your first term in this text-based role-playing game.

boardgame.name: Pull Stay
boardgame.description: Pull Stay is a wacky Beat 'em up game with Tower Defense mechanics. Use your fists or set crazy traps to repel enemies from rushing into your house! Defend your buddy Susumu, who goes out of his house only once in every two months for his haircut!

boardgame.name: Edo no Yami: Swords Sing Unseen
boardgame.description: In Edo no Yami, the player will have to rely on his senses and a cybernetic puppy to free the world.

boardgame.name: Raji: An Ancient Epic
boardgame.description: Raji: An Ancient Epic is an action-adventure game set in ancient India. A young girl named Raji has been chosen by the gods to stand against the demonic invasion of the human realm. Her destiny? To rescue her younger brother and face the demon lord Mahabalasura.

boardgame.name: JamSumo (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
The second edition of JamSumo now supports up to 5 players.

New Features:
Circular board. 5 platforms that can be removed and positioned to accommodate the various player counts. Each player receives 5 dice.

In ’Jam‘ the platforms have a new 'JAM line' which keeps the hole at a distance of 11cm so the 'hole in 1' shot is just as elusive.

In ’Sumo’ the platforms include a 'protection pier' which will protect you from a 'blast' shot from a ‘kamikaze’ neighbour.

boardgame.name: Ambuscades & Affairs of Outposts: Being a Pike & Shot Supplement for Knyghte, Pyke, and Sworde
boardgame.description:
''Ambuscades & Affairs of Outposts
This supplement for Knyghte Pyke and Sworde expands the rules to cover the beginning of Pike&Shot warfare in the late 1500s.

This is a period of transition from medieval warfare to the era of gun powder, where armored knights and archers were making their last desperate gestures, rubbing shoulders with musketeers and cannon.

Included is an overview of the period, new rules for pike blocks and pistol armed cavalry, 6 scenarios usable with any armies as well as a collection of ready-to-play profiles (with points values) for the following armies:

Spanish,
Dutch,
Huguenots,
French Catholics,
English,
Irish,
English Sea Dogs and
Spanish Colonial Troops.


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Knyghte, Pyke & Sworde: Medieval Mass Skirmish

boardgame.name: Scout and Doodle: The Forest of Mist
boardgame.description:
Scout and Doodle: the Forest of Fog is a flip and write game, in PnP version, part of the universe Rodentia: the board game, where rodents have united and managed to expel their predators, after the war control the wolves consequently the ancient forests were destroyed because of the battles and the hobby of the beavers for cutting them down, the scouting squirrels are trying reforest the Mist Forest of ash, oak, lime, elm and carpes.

Doodling on the map we represent a group of squirrels reforesting the Forest of Fog, while we face a Beaver, who does not stop cutting down trees and making dams.
We will cooperate to remember compasses. In turns, we will choose and flip a compass token, we will move around the map and draw trees / be careful with turning a compass with a beaver, anger for you and cut down trees.

At the end of the game we can be a swallow, a scout or a ranger, depending on the number of trees we have planted.

—description from the designer

“Scout and Doodle: el Bosque de la Niebla” es un juego de Flip and Write, en versión PnP, parte del universo de Rodentia: el juego de tablero, donde los roedores se han unido y logrado expulsar a sus depredadores, después de la guerra control los lobo, en consecuencia, los antiguos bosques quedaron destruidos a causa de las batallas y la afición de los castores por talarlos, las ardillas exploradoras están intentado reforestar el Bosque de la Niebla de fresnos, robles, tilos, olmos y carpes.

Al dibujar en el mapa representamos a un grupo de ardillas reforestando el Bosque de la Niebla, mientras nos enfrentamos a un Castor, que no para de talar árboles y hacer represas.

Cooperaremos para recordar la ubicación de las brujulas. Por turnos, escogeremos y voltearemos una ficha de brujula, nos moveremos por el mapa y dibujaremos arboles / cuidado con dar vuelta una brujula con un castor, el ira por ti y talara arboles.

Al final del juego podremos ser un golondrinas, scouts o rangers, según la cantidad de arboles que logramos plantamos.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

boardgame.name: KaZock
boardgame.description:
In KaZock, players try to get as many carrots as possible with dice luck and tactical flair.

Sometimes it is better to be satisfied with what you have achieved than to risk too much. The main thing is that in the end you have your nose in front and most of the carrots are collected.

On your turn, you roll three dice. Depending on the result of the dice, one or two carrots can then be taken from the supply or stolen by an opponent. Unfortunately, if you are unlucky you have to give back some of your hard-collected carrots.

In this game it is recommended to not only keep an eye on your own carrot pile, but to also watch the collections of the other players.

The game ends when the carrot supply in the middle of the table is used up and the player with the most carrots wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: UnberechenBER Das verrückte Flughafenspiel
boardgame.description:
Now it is finally here: The modern airport construction simulation!

Build an international airport and bring it online! Burn as many taxpayer dollars as possible: money doesn't matter!

Prove your expertise in eight sub-projects. Complete the largest infrastructure project since time immemorial. Take responsibility now!

But be careful!
It's not as simple as it sounds. Your resources are limited and unpredictable events always cause setbacks: managing directors come and go, the supervisory wheel is turned, escalators are suddenly too short and the fire smoke simply does not want to move through the basement. Sometimes you have to compromise to get there!

-- translation of publisher's description

This game is inspired by actual incidents in the construction of the Berlin Brandenburg airport.

boardgame.name: reky
boardgame.description:
A logic puzzle game, reky marries an elegance of design with an architectural minimalist aesthetic to create an experience that is fresh, stylish and satisfyingly challenging. The player interacts with the different puzzle elements of each level, shifting and moving them in order to create a path to the goal. Everything in the game is simple and functional, with only cubes, lines, exits, portals and a dash of color used to create a large variety of brain-teasing challenges.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Hyper Sentinel
boardgame.description:
A face-melting, pixel-pumping arcade shoot 'em up featuring awesome power-ups, epic boss battles and spectacular effects at a blistering 60fps. Blast into battle against giant space destroyers in Arcade Mode, tackle endless waves of enemies in Survival Mode and face off against epic level guardians in Boss Run mode.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Black Stories: Tödliche Liebe
boardgame.description:
How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the riddle by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party. This version of the black stories is about
love that takes someone's life.

boardgame.name: Weather
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

I looked up in alarm as a particularly loud thunderclap went off overhead. Vajra mouthed a silent prayer as she eyed the boiling blackness overhead.

“The gods are angry today,” she said, almost in awe.

The sky was certainly angry. The black rainclouds took on a greenish cast off to the west. The rain itself was coming down in sheets. The wind was gusting to worrisome levels. And the lightning…I knew we couldn’t stay exposed like this.

I wished we could’ve waited this storm out in the ATV, but The Colonel wasn’t about to let our target get away after coming so close. Not to mention the fifty thousand creds we’d get for catching him.

The rain suddenly stopped, as though Vajra’s gods had decided to flip the “off” switch. It was then that we both heard a loud, rushing sound. I looked westward, toward the noise. A few kilometers away, a spinning, grayish-white finger of cloud was reaching toward the ground below. Rope-thin at first, it gained girth as it touched down and announced its presence with a roar of wind and a veil of black dust.

Vajra spat a barbarian profanity upon seeing the tornado and looked around frantically for cover. I did the same, suddenly deciding the mission — and the money — wasn’t that important after all.

Modeling weather in a roleplaying game is often a hit-or-miss proposition. There are random tables, published and online, that can help, but the results can sometimes be unrealistic, even silly. Add to that the fact that meteorological processes can be almost impossibly complex, and it’s no wonder many Referees simply don’t bother introducing weather into their games, or if they do, they relegate it to the background. But the addition of inclement or violent weather can add more to the adventure than mere background or window-dressing, add tension and spice to the action, serve as an additional complication for the PCs, and add color to an alien environment.

This supplement for Cepheus Engine (CE) and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) gives the Referee the tools to emulate weather across an entire world ­– any world. Using a simple die mechanic and set of easily-applied modifiers, the Referee can quickly impose all sorts of weather effects, depending on the planet. The rules can even help model such local disturbances as insect swarms and troop movements.

Weather. The forecast is for fun, with widespread action.

boardgame.name: Black Stories Junior: Animal Stories
boardgame.description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: animal stories are tricky riddles for animal lovers. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

Black Stories Junior: animal stories includes fifty cards with riddles for you to puzzle out.

listing.notes: Title: Black Stories Junior: Animal Stories Publisher: Tucker's Fun Factory Language(s): Dutch

boardgame.name: The Continent of Arabor: Mythos Pack 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This gorgeous, full-color, 91 page campaign book takes you to the hidden Continent of Arabor where you will discover an entirely new realm of creatures, kindreds, and cultures you can use with Tunnels & Trolls. This continent-sized setting was created by John Briquelet who has been developing and running adventures in Arabor since the mid 1980s. A true labor of love and a great sourcebook for running campaigns in a whole new place that was built for T&T from the very beginning.

What it's about: Arabor was created by 12 god-wizards as a sanctuary from the Trollworld Wizard Wars, The realm harbors a wide variety of cultures most of whom are followers of at least one of the immortal god-wizards, who even after all this time still influence and control the destinies of their peoples. Its a place of mystery and intrique; a whole new realm to explore and adventure in that will remind you of Trollworld, but has had thousands of years to develop its own cultures, magics and monsters.

Travel to Doomwood, Kor's boneyard, the Kingdoms of Akoto, Danatha, Kyphan and many other lands and places in Arabor. Decide where you want to start your adventures or just admire what might well be one of most lavish books ever created for Tunnels & Trolls.

This 91 page book includes over 65 full-color illustrations, 2 detailed color maps, house rules, and Arabor kindred character roll-up instructions. Plus descriptions of the 12 god-wizards, 16 unique creatures, a timeline of events on Arabor, 12 unique kingdoms and much more. Once you've seen Arabor, you'll inspired to create adventures you can run using this new land of mystery and magic!

boardgame.name: The Chain of Nightmares
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The distant rocky outpost once known as Painter’s Peak was bolstered long ago to garrison a reconnaissance force and renamed Hollowrock Stronghold. But its recorded history as a quiet defensive position protecting the Tressian border never mentions its then sinister purpose. When the lands were under the Greater Tres Empire’s rule, the stronghold imprisoned high-value captives during the Silver Skirmishes. The stone fortress conceals prison cells and the specialized tools to extract guarded secrets underneath its unassuming walls. Thought abandoned by the empire centuries ago, one secret still endures. The spirits of this nightmarish place usurped their transgressors and remain to this day to torment those who dare trespass.

The Chain of Nightmares is a Q-Crawl, or Quick-Crawl, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 12th-level characters. This crawl would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Using Amazing Tales Therapeutically
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Child therapist Lilly Smith provides guidance on using Amazing Tales to help kids with additional needs reach their full potential. The six page guide includes advice on teamwork, social problem solving, impulse control, creativity and fine motor skills.

boardgame.name: Amazing Lessons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Baz Stevens, veteran GM and host of the UK gaming podcast 'What would the Smart Party do' talks about how he uses Amazing Tales to bring role-playing games to the classroom through his work as a teacher.

boardgame.name: Ceilings & Walls (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the ceilings and walls in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Ceilings & Floors is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Ceilings & Walls (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the ceilings and walls in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Ceilings & Floors is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!
